snippet: In a new letter, the rabbis of Congregation B’nai Jeshurun said their initial note had “omitted key passages honoring the diversity of viewpoints in our community.”
abstract: Rabbis of Manhattan synagogue Congregation B’nai Jeshurun express regret at tone of e-mail sent celebrating controversial vote by the United Nations to upgrade Palestine to observer-state status; say in new letter that their initial note had 'omitted key passages honoring the diversity of viewpoints in our community.'
lead_paragraph: In a new letter, the rabbis of Congregation B’nai Jeshurun said their initial note had “omitted key passages honoring the diversity of viewpoints in our community.”

headline.seo: Rabbis Apologize for Tone of E-Mail on U.N. Vote
headline.main: Rabbis Apologize for Tone of E-Mail on U.N. Vote
headline.print_headline: Rabbis Apologize for Tone of E-Mail on U.N. Vote
